channel.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
channel.description:
[tt]>CIA/FBI knew of 9/11, let it happen. >A never-ending, un-winnable war created to combat terrorism; a distraction and excuse to limit personal freedoms. >Patriot Act enabled government to spy on their citizens and the rest of the world. >National Defense Authorization Act passed to make the CIA's actions of assassination and indefinite detainment legal. >SOPA/PIPA plowed through congress to censor media by the government and corporations with the excuse to stop online piracy, yet the government already has the means to do so (see Megaupload)[/tt]
So, yeah - am I paranoid or am I smelling the smell of fascism in America coming in the near-future? Discuss.

item.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:39, topic:429913”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=532595.msg3929170#msg3929170 date=1330515863]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=532595.msg3929008#msg3929008 date=1330490090]

t4: I think he is targeting MITB, who thing the government is just a tool of evil.

I never said that, and I don’t think it. But there should always be some healthy skepticism of any government, otherwise people become too complacent and then bad things do happen. Only an idiot would blindly assume his government always has his best interest in mind, right?
[/quote]So why haven’t you guys overthrown your government yet? The CIA commits atrocities every year, and the government doesn’t intervene.

I am under the belief that the liberal gun laws are really just used by the government as a counter. They know that there will never be any revolution, and they also know that the people believe they have control if they own guns, and as such they can really just do whatever the fuck they want.
[/quote]Haha, one guy single handedly overthrowing the government by shooting up the place.

Good one Johan, good one.

Most people would think the guns are for when the government comes after them directly… It should be used for a revolution though, but the government will certainly try to take guns away.[/quote]My point is still valid, and i think you see that.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I paranoid or on to something?

I never said that, and I don’t think it. But there should always be some healthy skepticism of any government, otherwise people become too complacent and then bad things do happen. Only an idiot would blindly assume his government always has his best interest in mind, right?
[/quote]So why haven’t you guys overthrown your government yet? The CIA commits atrocities every year, and the government doesn’t intervene.

I am under the belief that the liberal gun laws are really just used by the government as a counter. They know that there will never be any revolution, and they also know that the people believe they have control if they own guns, and as such they can really just do whatever the fuck they want.[/quote]Haha, one guy single handedly overthrowing the government by shooting up the place.

Good one Johan, good one.

Most people would think the guns are for when the government comes after them directly… It should be used for a revolution though, but the government will certainly try to take guns away.

item.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Before they went too far at all they took away all of the citizen’s guns, supposedly for their safety of course. Same as Australia and Britain did not too long ago.

gun politics in great briton are a funny thing, from the 60s to 80s semi automatic weapons and the such were allowed (although personal defence has never been a valid reason unless under rare circumstances), the first major ban on guns was in the 80s effectively banning everything but pistols and long barrel shotguns, the second ban was in 1997 which banned pistols and tightened the permit for long barrel shotguns

both bans in gun ownership were triggered by a massacre where the gunman obtained his weapons legally, had these events not happened, the laws and more importantly the public’s opinion on guns might have ended up a little more lax

fun fact: northern island is the only part of the uk where guns are legal and use for self defence is a valid reason for owning a gun

Read full topic
item.source: Am I paranoid or on to something?

item.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:27, topic:429913”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=532595.msg3928976#msg3928976 date=1330487798]
t4: I think he is targeting MITB, who thing the government is just a tool of evil.
[/quote]

I never said that, and I don’t think it. But there should always be some healthy skepticism of any government, otherwise people become too complacent and then bad things do happen. Only an idiot would blindly assume his government always has his best interest in mind, right?[/quote]So why haven’t you guys overthrown your government yet? The CIA commits atrocities every year, and the government doesn’t intervene.

I am under the belief that the liberal gun laws are really just used by the government as a counter. They know that there will never be any revolution, and they also know that the people believe they have control if they own guns, and as such they can really just do whatever the fuck they want.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I paranoid or on to something?

item.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Moparisthebest:

They definitely aren’t good things, anything, no matter how slowly, that encroaches on our freedom is bad. But fascism in the near future? I doubt it for one sole reason. All countries in the past that went that route, […]Nazi Germany[…] Before they went too far at all they took away all of the citizen’s guns, supposedly for their safety of course.

You’re wrong, and I wonder who gave you this piece of false information. The Nazi government didn’t take away guns from their citizens. They actually encouraged their citizens to own guns. The only regulated handguns.

The first important revision in the 1938 law concerns the scope of the gun control regulation regarding the need for an acquisition permit: whereas the 1928 law regarding the acquisition or transfer of guns applied to “firearms and ammunition,” which included any and all “weapons from which a bullet or a load of pellets may be driven through a barrel, by means of the development of an explosive gas or air pressure” i.e. rifles, shotguns, handguns, etc.—the 1938 law applied only to “handguns.” In other words, the 1938 revisions completely deregulated the acquisition and transfer of rifles and shotguns, as well as ammunition.
Source: BERNARD E. HARCOURT: HITLER AND GUN REGISTRATION

This essay goes on about other revisions of the gun law in Germany. Although handguns were regulated, a hunting licence was enough to own a handgun.

You’re talking out of your ass, MITB. I find it appalling that you use arguments to shock people and get them on your side, when they are completely false to begin with. Is this normal in the US? Do you Americans just come up with outrageous arguments, trying to picture a dystopian future, hoping no one will check the validity of your arguments? Rick Santorum did the same a few weeks ago, when he talked about euthanasia in the Netherlands. He was spewing nonsense, just like you are doing.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I paranoid or on to something?

Said US did because a fascistic state (You would keep the weapons), how would you be able to fight the world’s strongest military?

item.title: Am I paranoid or on to something?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

They definitely aren’t good things, anything, no matter how slowly, that encroaches on our freedom is bad. But fascism in the near future? I doubt it for one sole reason. All countries in the past that went that route, be it Soviet Russia, Nazi Germany, Communist Cuba, or any other had one thing in common. Before they went too far at all they took away all of the citizen’s guns, supposedly for their safety of course. Same as Australia and Britain did not too long ago. So if we can protect that one single right we should be safe, other countries are screwed.

Read full topic
